review_title: We Save Lives, Future of Organ Donation
job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Tulsa, OK
pros:
Life Share of Oklahoma, has been a incredible experience, from the benefit package including 401K and healthcare to company gifts of appreciation throughout the year. They are on the cutting edge of advancement in organ donation with the adding new recovery staff, equipment and training to complete the mission of saving lives daily. This is why they are one of the top OPO's in the country.

Organ Recovery is a team/family atmosphere, the team I work with in Tulsa are always available to me by phone when I need them even on days off. 

Leadership and HR have a open door policy, when complaints in organ are given solutions are always encouraged and implemented as quickly as possible.
cons: In healthcare work/life balance is always a struggle, the clinical staff struggles with connecting to purpose due to high demand of the position and long hours away from family.

review_title: This is the best place to be!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: This place is more than a job--it's a family. We work very closely together to share one common passion: saving lives. We all understand the impact we have on the lives of all those we help, and we take great pride in what we do. The management is fair and caring, and the communication between management and staff is beyond compare. We all take care of each other and fill in for others when they have family needs arise. Our pay is excellent, our insurance is excellent, and I have never been treated so well at any other place I have worked. The best part of working here, however, is knowing that every single day we can leave the office knowing that we saved lives and helped our fellow Oklahomans. That's an incredible feeling!
cons: The only negative thing about working here is that it is stressful at times. We have to remember that we are, in our role to save lives, dealing with death and bereaved families. It is difficult on some days when we have a child donor or when we have a family who wasn't prepared to make the decision whether to donate. Sometimes the hours are long and the emotions can run high, but we try to remember what lies on the other side: lives saved. We also have audits that are done by our accrediting agencies and those take some extra work for sure!
